TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

ok then here it is: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/19BL5-aCD0atOJRzKQyRm1gfoxyTAaaA8/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/19BL5-aCD0atOJRzKQyRm1gfoxyTAaaA8/view?usp=sharing)

Help! Scatterer breaks my game. When I am on Kerbin with the mod installed, there are odd effects, almost like the ocean texture floating in the sky, also when looking straight up, the sky has a number of black circles in an almost lattice pattern.

[@tilliepops](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/222034-tilliepops/)

I'm not seeing major errors except for Steam complaining and one Module Manager error with <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>, neither of which, I think, are likely to cause your symptoms.  I'll defer to wiser folk.  You do have multiple versions of <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> in the install so I recommend removing all but the latest, but I believe <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> detects and runs only the most recent version in your install.

Am I correct that you're running on Linux?  Can you run KSP on DirectX instead of OpenGL?

How did you install your mods - manually or through <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>?  Unless someone else has an easier solution, all I can recommend is that you start with a clean install (see below) and start adding mods in small groups until the problem reappears.

I do have a suggestion for you:  Never run KSP directly from the Steam install.  Instead, download and keep the Steam KSP directory pristine, then copy it to another folder.  Mod and play the copy.  This prevents Steam from updating your current game when you don't want it to.  This is less important now than when KSP was being updated frequently but it also reduces multiple, excessive Steam downloads.  If you're on a limited or a metered connection, this will save time and money.

This copying is legal to do.  You can have as many versions of KSP as you want as you play different KSP versions, mod combinations or game experience experiments without compromising your favorite saves.

[@ThatBattleCow](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/222095-thatbattlecow/)please read the posts above yours for some initial steps you need to take so that others can help you sort that out.

I also don't remember seeing a Kopernicus icon for just generic Kopernicus uses, so maybe it is an out of date version causing the game to break. Hope you get this fixed!

> 

Yeah...nope ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P").  The log you posted suggests otherwise.  You have plenty of mods installed (see lines 719 to 812) and, as [@Benzo Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/218403-benzo-kerman/)suggests, Kopernicus, which enables KSP to handle planet packs can cause this.

I have you tried removing Kopernicus from your current KSP install (and removing any Kopernicus folder from GameData) and reinstalling it?

Also, install Zero MiniAVC because MiniAVC is known to cause problems.

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="129964" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed2741993132" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/174445-112x-malahs-quick-mods-important-update-for-zerominiavc/&do=embed" style="height:197px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

Aside from that - and this is the brute-force approach - I would suggest starting with a fresh download of KSP from Steam, copy that KSP folder in its entirety to another folder, run it to the main menu and quit (it creates some files on first run), and then start installing mods and their dependencies a few at a time.  Run KSP each time to see if the problem reappears.

I would recommend using <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> to ensure you capture those dependencies and avoid some basic incompatibilities, if you aren't using it already.  Manual installs will work fine but unless you're really comfortable with managing compatibility issues I would default to <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr>.  Just my personal opinion.

[@tilliepops](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/222034-tilliepops/)

You MUST install ZeroMiniAVC.  If you still have any MiniAVC.dll files installed, all bets are off, it got broken sometime back around 1.8 or so.

>

> 8 hours ago, Benzo Kerman said:
> 
> 
> [@tilliepops](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/222034-tilliepops/) it looks like you still have Kopernicus installed, try removing that. I also don't remember seeing a Kopernicus icon for just generic Kopernicus uses, so maybe it is an out of date version causing the game to break. Hope you get this fixed!
> 

Actually, the icon is a newer feature of the latest releases, suggesting he is up to date.

I would agree with the suggestion that the poster should try <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr>, though.

EDIT:  Looking at his log, he is also on AMD hardware on MacOSX in OpenGL mode, if it makes any difference.  Not sure how good AMD drivers are on OSX, but they historically are terrible in OpenGL on windows, so...  then again the only choice he'd have to get better drivers is pretty much "install linux," which I can't advise either.  I'm going to go with "piece by piece reinstall" as my recommendation as well.

> > > 9 hours ago, tilliepops said: > > > EDIT 2 i think this is the updated log > Hi [@tilliepops](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/222034-tilliepops/), Just a side note to let you know that we've snipped the large log file contents from your post. We understand that you mean well, and it's good to share log files. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Please try to avoid pasting really big ones into the forum itself, though, because it causes problems for people. Even if it's supposedly "hidden" in a spoiler, it forces the web browser to download the entire contents even if the person doesn't open the spoiler. This can cause problems for folks, especially on mobile devices. There's nothing wrong with pasting a page or two into a spoiler. However, if the content is thousands of lines long, best to post it to some third-party file sharing site instead, and then post a *link* to it here in the forum. That way, everyone wins. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") We're sorry for the inconvenience, and thank you for your understanding!
